Class ChessBoard

java.lang.Object
  ChessBoard

public class ChessBoard
extends java.lang.Object

This class can store the chess board. It knows about its dimensions, its position and the kind of pieces that are on it.

Version:
$Id: ChessBoard.java,v 1.15 2006/05/19 09:50:30 obooij Exp $
Author:
Nikos Massios, Matthijs Spaan

Field Detail

coords

public Point coords
The coordinates of the corner next to H8. They are measured in millimeters.

normal

public Vector3D normal
The normal vector on the chess board. Usually (0,0,1) since the board lays flat on the table.

theta

public double theta
The angle between between the board and the .. axis. It is measured in degrees.

delta_x

public double delta_x
The width of a chess board square in the x direction. It is measured in millimeters.

delta_y

public double delta_y
The width of a chess board square in the y direction. It is measured in millimeters.

board_thickness

public double board_thickness
The thickness of the chess board. It is measured in millimeters.

sur_x

public double sur_x
The width of the border of the chess board in the x direction. It is measured in millimeters.

sur_y

public double sur_y
The width of the border of the chess board in the y direction. It is measured in millimeters.

aliveChessPieces

public java.util.Vector aliveChessPieces
A java vector holding all the "alive" chess pieces still on the chess board. It has a variable length.

deadChessPieces

public java.util.Vector deadChessPieces
A java vector holding all the "dead" chess pieces, currenly off the chess board. It has a variable length.

Constructor Detail

ChessBoard

public ChessBoard()
Primary constructor. It initialises all the class fields related to the board dimentions. However the location of the chess pieces has to be read from a file.

See Also:
coords, normal, delta_x, delta_y, sur_x, sur_y, board_thickness, theta, aliveChessPieces, deadChessPieces

ChessBoard

public ChessBoard(Point coords,
                  double theta)
Secondary constructor. It initialises all the class fields related to the board dimentions. The starting coords and angle of the board (theta) have to be supplied. The location of the chess pieces has to be read from a file.

See Also:
coords, normal, delta_x, delta_y, sur_x, sur_y, board_thickness, theta, aliveChessPieces, deadChessPieces
Method Detail

read

public void read()
This method reads the pieces and their locations on the board from the gnuchessr style file "board.gch" file. It sets the aliveChessPieces and deadChessPieces fields.

See Also:
aliveChessPieces, deadChessPieces

movePiece

public void movePiece(java.lang.String from,
                      java.lang.String to)
               throws ChessBoard.NoPieceAtPositionException
This method can move a chess piece from the board location specified in its first argument to the board location specified in its second argument. It updates the aliveChessPieces field and the deadChessPieces field (in case a piece needs to be removed first).

Parameters:
from - The board location to move the piece from.
to - The board location to move the piece to.
Throws:
NoPieceAtPositionException - if from is empty.
ChessBoard.NoPieceAtPositionException
See Also:
aliveChessPieces

removePiece

public void removePiece(java.lang.String pos)
                 throws ChessBoard.NoPieceAtPositionException
This method can move a chess piece from the board location specified in its argument to the "dead" chess pieces list. It updates the aliveChessPieces and deadChessPieces fields.

Parameters:
pos - The board location to move the piece from.
Throws:
NoPieceAtPositionException - if pos is already empty.
ChessBoard.NoPieceAtPositionException
See Also:
aliveChessPieces, deadChessPieces

hasPiece

public boolean hasPiece(java.lang.String pos)
This method checks if the board location specified in its argument is occupied by an alive chess piece. It uses the aliveChessPieces field.

Parameters:
pos - The board location to check for a piece.
See Also:
aliveChessPieces

getHeight

public double getHeight(java.lang.String pos)
                 throws ChessBoard.NoPieceAtPositionException
This method returns the height of the chess piece at the location specified in its argument.

Parameters:
pos - The board location to check for its height.
Returns:
The height of the chess piece at that location.
Throws:
NoPieceAtPositionException - if pos is empty.
ChessBoard.NoPieceAtPositionException

getDiameter

public double getDiameter(java.lang.String pos)
                   throws ChessBoard.NoPieceAtPositionException
This method returns the diameter of the chess piece at the location specified in its argument.

Parameters:
pos - The board location to check for its diameter.
Returns:
The diameter of the chess piece at that location.
Throws:
NoPieceAtPositionException - if pos is empty.
ChessBoard.NoPieceAtPositionException

getSide

public java.lang.String getSide(java.lang.String pos)
                         throws ChessBoard.NoPieceAtPositionException
This method returns the side (color) of the chess piece at the location specified in its argument.

Parameters:
pos - The board location to check for its diameter.
Returns:
The side of the chess piece at that location.
Throws:
NoPieceAtPositionException - if pos is empty.
ChessBoard.NoPieceAtPositionException

getPiece

public ChessPiece getPiece(java.lang.String pos)
                    throws ChessBoard.NoPieceAtPositionException
This method returns the chess piece at the location specified in its argument.

Parameters:
pos - The board location to check for a live chess piece.
Returns:
The chess piece at that location.
Throws:
NoPieceAtPositionException - if pos is empty.
ChessBoard.NoPieceAtPositionException

toCartesian

public Point toCartesian(int row,
                         int column)
This method returns the cartesian coordinates of the chess piece at the location specified in its arguments.

Parameters:
row - The row of the board location to check for its coordinates.
column - The column of board location to check for its coordinates.
Returns:
The cartesian coordinates of the board location, relative to the origin.

toCartesian

public Point toCartesian(java.lang.String pos)
This method returns the cartesian coordinates of the chess piece at the location specified in its argument.

Parameters:
pos - The board location to check for its coordinates.
Returns:
The cartesian coordinates of the board location, relative to the origin.

print

public void print()
This method prints the board. It prints a text drawing of the board at System.out. This drawing contains just the locations and types of chess pieces. It also list the pieces removed from the game.

setup

public void setup()
This method sets up the board in the standard chess startup setting. Does not empty the board first.
